page.title: 09Salhouse Primary School 1
page.content: {Salhouse Primary School}was built in 1975 to replace the old village school.There are 108 pupils aged from 5 to 11 yrs.The headmaster{Mr Hobbs} has a staff of 4 full time teachers and 1 part time (50%) teaching 4 to 5 classes.There are about 27 children in each class and the oldest have homework. The school opens at 9a.m. and closes at 3p.m. and has fifteen minutes playtime in the morning and afternoon.They have seventy minutes for lunch.There is no school uniform at the moment but pupils are encouraged to wear blue and grey. The Headmaster lives in an old thatched house in the village next to The Bell Inn! (contd on page 10)
